summary: Madeira is an autonomous region of Portugal, made up of several islands in the North Atlantic Ocean. It's known for its wine, beautiful forests, and mild climate. The capital is Funchal, where most people live.  Discovered by Portuguese explorers in 1419, Madeira is now a popular vacation spot, especially for Portuguese, British, and German tourists. It's also an important stop for cruise ships traveling across the Atlantic.  The region has its own government and is part of the European Union.
title: Madeira
